logTitle: IELTS Reading Log: To catch a king (Part 1)

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...Anna Keay reviews Charles Spencer's book about the hunt for King Charles II...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Cuộc 'hunt' (săn lùng) 'for' (nhằm vào) Vua Charles II

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A major search or pursuit, often organized, to find and capture someone or something
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Cuộc săn lùng (ai đó/cái gì đó)

phase3Production.content: The police organized a nationwide hunt for the escaped prisoner.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...after his resounding defeat at the Battle of Worcester in September 1651.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'defeat' (thất bại) 'resounding' (vang dội, rất lớn)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A very big, complete, or definite defeat
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một thất bại thảm hại/vang dội

phase3Production.content: The election ended in a resounding defeat for the incumbent party.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the young Charles II sacrificed one of the very principles his father had died for...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Sacrificed' (hy sinh) một trong những 'principles' (nguyên tắc) mà cha ông đã chết vì nó

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To give up a fundamental belief or rule of conduct, often for a perceived greater good or personal gain
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Hy sinh một trong những nguyên tắc

phase3Production.content: He was accused of sacrificing his artistic principles for commercial success.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and did a deal with the Scots, thereby accepting Presbyterianism...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Did a deal' (thực hiện một thỏa thuận) 'with' (với) người Scots

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To make an agreement or arrangement with someone, often in a business or political context
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thỏa thuận với (ai đó)

phase3Production.content: The company did a deal with a local supplier to reduce costs.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: His arrival in Edinburgh prompted the English Parliamentary army to invade Scotland...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự có mặt của ông ta đã 'prompted' (thúc đẩy, xúi giục) quân đội Anh 'to invade' (xâm lược) Scotland

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To cause someone to take a particular course of action
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thúc đẩy/khiến (ai đó) làm (gì đó)

phase3Production.content: The new evidence prompted the police to reopen the investigation.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to invade Scotland in a pre-emptive strike.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'strike' (cuộc tấn công) 'pre-emptive' (phủ đầu, đón đầu, trước khi bị tấn công)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An attack launched to prevent an expected enemy attack from happening
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một đòn tấn công phủ đầu/tiên hạ thủ vi cường

phase3Production.content: The air force launched a pre-emptive strike on the enemy's missile sites.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: After being comprehensively defeated on the meadows outside the city...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Bị 'defeated' (đánh bại) một cách 'comprehensively' (toàn diện, hoàn toàn)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be beaten completely and thoroughly in a battle, argument, or competition
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bị đánh bại (một cách) toàn diện

phase3Production.content: Our team was comprehensively defeated in the final match, losing 5-0.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: the subject of a national manhunt
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the king found himself the subject of a national manhunt...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Nhà vua thấy mình là 'subject' (đối tượng) 'of' (của) một 'national manhunt' (cuộc truy lùng toàn quốc)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be the person that a large, organized search (often by police or military) across the whole country is trying to find
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đối tượng của một cuộc truy lùng toàn quốc

phase3Production.content: After escaping prison, he became the subject of a national manhunt.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...with a huge sum offered for his capture.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'huge sum' (số tiền lớn) 'offered' (được đưa ra) 'for his capture' (để bắt ông ta)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A very large amount of money was promised as a reward for capturing him
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một khoản tiền lớn được treo thưởng

phase3Production.content: The museum offered a huge sum for the return of the stolen painting.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...through a series of heart-poundingly close escapes...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những 'escapes' (cuộc trốn thoát) 'close' (sát sao, suýt soát). 'Heart-poundingly' (làm tim đập thình thịch)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Situations in which one almost gets caught or harmed but manages to get away just in time
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những cuộc trốn thoát trong gang tấc

phase3Production.content: This means he almost got caught many times. Each time, he *just* managed to get away. They were so 'close' they made his heart pound.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to evade the Parliamentarians before seeking refuge in France.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Evade' (lẩn trốn, né tránh) khỏi lính của Nghị viện

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To escape from or avoid someone or something, especially by cleverness or trickery
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Lẩn trốn, né tránh (ai đó/cái gì đó)

phase3Production.content: The suspect managed to evade the police for several weeks.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...before seeking refuge in France.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Seeking' (tìm kiếm) 'refuge' (nơi ẩn náu, nơi tị nạn) 'in' (ở) Pháp

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To look for a safe place, especially to escape from danger or persecution
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tìm nơi ẩn náu/nơi tị nạn ở (một nơi)

phase3Production.content: Many families had to flee their homes, seeking refuge in neighbouring countries.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: For the next nine years, the penniless and defeated Charles wandered around Europe...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Penniless' (không một xu dính túi) 'and' (và) 'defeated' (bị đánh bại, thất bại)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Having no money at all and having been beaten (in battle or spirit)
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Không một xu dính túi và thất bại

phase3Production.content: He arrived in the new city penniless and defeated, but determined to start again.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Years later, after his restoration as king, Charles II requested a meeting...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự 'restoration' (phục hồi, phục vị) 'as king' (với tư cách là vua)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The act of returning a monarch to their throne or position of power
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự phục vị (làm vua)

phase3Production.content: The museum is celebrating the 300th anniversary of the restoration of the monarchy.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...with the writer and diarist Samuel Pepys.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'writer' (nhà văn) và 'diarist' (người viết 'diary' - nhật ký)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A person who writes a regular record of their thoughts, feelings, and experiences
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Người viết nhật ký

phase3Production.content: Anne Frank is perhaps the most famous diarist of the 20th century.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: His intention when asking Pepys to commit his story to paper was to ensure...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Commit' (giao phó, gửi gắm) câu chuyện 'to paper' (lên giấy tờ) -> 'viết ra giấy'

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To write something down; to record thoughts or a story in written form
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Viết (cái gì đó) ra giấy

phase3Production.content: The poet felt a strong urge to commit her feelings to paper.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...this most extraordinary episode was never forgotten.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'episode' (phần, hồi) 'extraordinary' (phi thường, đặc biệt)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A very unusual, special, or remarkable event or period of time
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một hồi/giai đoạn phi thường

phase3Production.content: The fall of the Berlin Wall was an extraordinary episode in modern history.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the king related in great detail his personal recollections of the six weeks...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Những 'recollections' (hồi ức) 'personal' (cá nhân)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A person's own memories of past events
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Những hồi ức cá nhân

phase3Production.content: The biography is based on the author's personal recollections of her childhood.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the six weeks he had spent as a fugitive.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'fugitive' (người lẩn trốn, người chạy trốn)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A person who is running away or hiding, especially from the police or in a time of war
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Kẻ chạy trốn, người tị nạn

phase3Production.content: He spent years living as a fugitive before he was finally caught.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...Charles commenced his story: 'After the battle...'

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Commenced' (bắt đầu) câu chuyện của mình

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To begin or start telling his narrative (a more formal word for 'began')
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bắt đầu câu chuyện của mình

phase3Production.content: After the guests were seated, the speaker commenced his presentation.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the battle was so absolutely lost as to be beyond hope of recovery...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Beyond' (vượt quá) 'hope of recovery' (hy vọng phục hồi/cứu vãn)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: In a state so bad that it is impossible to be saved, fixed, or cured
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Vô vọng cứu vãn/phục hồi

phase3Production.content: After the fire, the historic building was considered beyond hope of recovery.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The day-by-day retelling of the fugitives' doings provides delicious details...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự 'retelling' (kể lại) 'day-by-day' (hàng ngày, từng ngày một)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A narrative or account of events as they happened each day
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự kể lại theo từng ngày

phase3Production.content: The blog provided a day-by-day retelling of his journey across the desert.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...as the Parliamentary soldiers scoured the floor below.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Lính 'scoured' (lùng sục, tìm kiếm kỹ) 'the floor below' (tầng/khu vực bên dưới)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To search a place or thing very carefully and thoroughly
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Lùng sục/sục sạo khu vực bên dưới

phase3Production.content: The rescue team scoured the mountainside for any sign of the missing hiker.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...such as the preposterous refusal of Charles's friend...to adopt disguise...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự 'refusal' (từ chối) 'preposterous' (vô lý, lố bịch)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An act of saying no that is completely unreasonable, ridiculous, or absurd
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự từ chối lố bịch/vô lý

phase3Production.content: His preposterous refusal to apologize, even when he was clearly wrong, angered everyone.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...refusal...to adopt disguise on the grounds that it was beneath his dignity...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Adopt' (chấp nhận, sử dụng) 'disguise' (sự cải trang)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To put on clothes and change one's appearance in order to hide one's true identity
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Cải trang, ngụy trang

phase3Production.content: The spy had to adopt a disguise to enter the enemy's headquarters.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to adopt disguise on the grounds that it was beneath his dignity...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'On the grounds that' (trên cơ sở là, vì lý do là) nó... 'beneath his dignity' (dưới phẩm giá)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: For the reason that; because. (Used to give a formal reason or justification for an action)
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Với lý do là; bởi vì

phase3Production.content: He was fired on the grounds that he had repeatedly violated company policy.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...it was beneath his dignity...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Ở 'beneath' (bên dưới) 'his dignity' (phẩm giá của ông ta) -> 'hạ thấp phẩm giá'

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Considered to be below one's level of importance or self-respect; too degrading or shameful to do
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Hạ thấp/dưới phẩm giá của (ai đó)

phase3Production.content: He felt that apologizing to his junior colleague was beneath his dignity.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and the emotional tension when the secret of the king's presence was... revealed...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Tension' (sự căng thẳng) 'emotional' (về mặt cảm xúc)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A feeling of nervousness, excitement, or suppressed emotion in a situation or between people
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự căng thẳng về cảm xúc

phase3Production.content: You could feel the emotional tension in the room as they waited for the verdict.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...the secret of the king's presence was cautiously revealed to his supporters.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được 'revealed' (tiết lộ) một cách 'cautiously' (cẩn trọng, dè dặt)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To make something known in a careful way, to avoid danger or risk
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tiết lộ một cách cẩn trọng

phase3Production.content: The government cautiously revealed its plans for the new tax reform.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Charles's adventures... hide the uncomfortable truth that...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'truth' (sự thật) 'uncomfortable' (không thoải mái, khó chịu, khó chấp nhận)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A fact or reality that is unpleasant to acknowledge, hear, or accept
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự thật khó nghe/khó chấp nhận

phase3Production.content: He had to eventually tell his client the uncomfortable truth about the case.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...almost everyone in England had been appalled by the execution of his father...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Bị 'appalled' (kinh hoàng, sốc) 'by' (bởi) vụ hành quyết

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be greatly shocked, horrified, or disgusted by something
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bị kinh hoàng/sốc bởi

phase3Production.content: The public was appalled by the brutality of the attack.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...had instead firmly bolted their doors.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Bolted' (cài then) 'their doors' (cửa) một cách 'firmly' (chắc chắn)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To securely lock one's doors, often out of fear or refusal to allow entry
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Cài then cửa chắc chắn

phase3Production.content: Hearing the storm approach, the villagers firmly bolted their doors and windows.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...what looked like a foreign invasion force...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'invasion force' (lực lượng xâm lược) 'foreign' (nước ngoài)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An army from another country that enters a country by force in order to take control
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một lực lượng xâm lược nước ngoài

phase3Production.content: The coastal defences were on high alert for a potential foreign invasion force.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...after almost a decade of civil war, people were desperate...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'decade' (thập kỷ) 'of' (của) 'civil war' (nội chiến)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A period of ten years during which a country is fighting against itself
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một thập kỷ nội chiến
relatedCollocates: on the brink of civil war

phase3Production.content: After a decade of civil war, the country was in ruins.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...people were desperate to avoid it beginning again.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Desperate' (tuyệt vọng, khao khát) 'to avoid' (để né tránh) nó

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Having a very strong need or desire to prevent something from happening
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tuyệt vọng/khao khát né tránh (cái gì)

phase3Production.content: He was desperate to avoid another argument with his boss.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...causing eye-rolling among courtiers...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Gây ra 'eye-rolling' (sự đảo mắt, biểu lộ sự chán ngán) 'among' (trong đám) 'courtiers' (cận thần)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Leading to a reaction of annoyance, disbelief, or exasperation from a group of people
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Gây ra sự chán ngán/đảo mắt trong (một nhóm)

phase3Production.content: His constant bragging was causing eye-rolling among his colleagues.

lexicalItems.targetLexeme: set in train a series of initiatives
lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...he set in train a series of initiatives to memorialise it.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Set in train' (bắt đầu, khởi động) một 'series' (loạt) 'of initiatives' (sáng kiến)

phase2Annotation.phonetic: /set ɪn treɪn ə ˈsɪəriːz əv ɪˈnɪʃətɪvz/
phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To start a process or sequence of actions or new plans
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Khởi động một loạt các sáng kiến

phase3Production.content: The new CEO set in train a series of initiatives to improve company culture.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...a series of initiatives to memorialise it.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Để 'memorialise' (tưởng niệm, kỷ niệm) nó

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To create something to preserve the memory of a person or event
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tưởng niệm, kỷ niệm

phase3Production.content: The city built a statue to memorialise the soldiers who died in the war.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: There was to be a new order of chivalry, the Knights of the Royal Oak.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'order' (dòng, hội) 'of chivalry' (hiệp sĩ, tinh thần thượng võ)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A formal society or brotherhood of knights, bound by honour and a code of conduct
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Dòng tu/hội hiệp sĩ

phase3Production.content: He was inducted into the ancient order of chivalry for his service to the crown.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: A series of enormous oil paintings depicting the episode were produced...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Depicting' (mô tả, khắc họa) 'the episode' (hồi/giai đoạn đó)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Representing or showing the event or period of time in a painting, drawing, or writing
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Khắc họa/mô tả giai đoạn đó

phase3Production.content: The mural is famous for depicting the city's history in great detail.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...six similarly enormous paintings of the king on the run.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Nhà vua 'on the run' (trên đường chạy trốn)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: In the process of escaping or hiding from the police or other authorities
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Đang trên đường chạy trốn
relatedCollocates: forced to go on the run

phase3Production.content: He spent three years on the run before he was finally captured.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: In 1660, Charles II commissioned the artist John Michael Wright to paint...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Commissioned' (ủy thác, đặt hàng) 'the artist' (người nghệ sĩ)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To formally choose and pay an artist to create a specific piece of art
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Ủy thác/đặt hàng người nghệ sĩ

phase3Production.content: The wealthy merchant commissioned the artist to paint a portrait of his family.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...or indeed pulling off such an escape in the first place.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Pulling off' (thực hiện thành công) 'such an escape' (một cuộc trốn thoát như vậy)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To succeed in achieving something difficult, like a complex escape
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thực hiện thành công một cuộc trốn thoát

phase3Production.content: It was a daring plan, and no one believed they could succeed in pulling off such a heist.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: His pacey, readable prose steers deftly clear of...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Prose' (văn xuôi) 'readable' (dễ đọc) 'pacey' (nhịp độ nhanh)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Writing (non-poetry) that is easy to read and moves at a quick, engaging speed
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Lối văn xuôi nhanh, dễ đọc

phase3Production.content: The author is known for his pacey, readable prose, which makes his novels hard to put down.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: His pacey, readable prose steers deftly clear of modern idioms...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Steers clear of' (né tránh) một cách 'deftly' (khéo léo) các 'idioms' hiện đại

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To cleverly and skilfully avoid something
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Khéo léo né tránh (cái gì đó)

phase3Production.content: The politician steers deftly clear of any controversial questions.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and elegantly brings to life the details of the great tale.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Brings to life' (làm sống động) các chi tiết một cách 'elegantly' (thanh lịch, trang nhã)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To make something seem real, vivid, and exciting in a graceful and stylish way
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Làm sống động (một cách) trang nhã

phase3Production.content: The director's use of music elegantly brings to life the character's inner turmoil.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: He has even-handed sympathy for both the fugitive king and...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự 'sympathy' (đồng cảm) 'even-handed' (công bằng, không thiên vị) 'for' (cho) cả hai bên

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A fair and impartial feeling of understanding and compassion for all sides of a conflict
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự đồng cảm công bằng/không thiên vị

phase3Production.content: The documentary was praised for its even-handed sympathy for both the victims and their families.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and the fierce republican regime that hunted him.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'regime' (chế độ) 'republican' (cộng hòa) 'fierce' (mãnh liệt, hung dữ)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A government (that is not a monarchy) which is intense, aggressive, and powerful
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Chế độ cộng hòa khắc nghiệt/mãnh liệt

phase3Production.content: The rebels were fighting against the fierce republican regime.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and he succeeds in his desire to explore far more...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Succeeds in' (thành công trong) 'his desire' (mong muốn của mình)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To successfully achieve what one wants to do
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thành công trong mong muốn

phase3Production.content: She finally succeeded in her desire to become a pilot.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...which for some will be reason alone to read...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Reason' (lý do) 'alone' (duy nhất, chỉ riêng) -> 'chỉ riêng lý do đó cũng đủ'

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The single, sufficient reason, without needing any others
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Chỉ riêng lý do đó (cũng đủ)

phase3Production.content: The film's stunning visuals are reason alone to see it on the big screen.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: The tantalising question left, in the end, is that of what it all meant.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'question' (câu hỏi) 'tantalising' (trêu ngươi, hấp dẫn, gây tò mò)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A question that is very appealing and makes you want to know the answer, but may be difficult to resolve
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Câu hỏi hấp dẫn/gây tò mò

phase3Production.content: The novel ends on a cliffhanger, leaving the tantalising question of the hero's fate.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Did the need to assume disguises, to survive on wit...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Assume' (cho là, đảm nhận) 'disguises' (sự cải trang) -> 'hóa trang', 'cải trang'

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To put on clothes/change appearance to hide one's identity (synonym for 'adopt disguise')
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Hóa trang, cải trang

phase3Production.content: The rebels had to assume disguises to move through the city unnoticed.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to survive on wit and charm alone...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Survive' (sống sót) 'on' (dựa vào) 'wit' (sự lanh lợi) 'and' (và) 'charm' (sự quyến rũ)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To manage to live or get by using only one's intelligence, cleverness, and ability to please people
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sống sót/xoay xở bằng sự lanh lợi và quyến rũ

phase3Production.content: With no money, the young traveller had to survive on his wit and charm.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to use trickery and subterfuge to escape...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sử dụng 'trickery' (sự lừa lọc) 'and' (và) 'subterfuge' (mánh khóe, mưu mẹo)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The use of dishonest methods, deceit, or clever tricks to achieve something
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự lừa lọc và mưu mẹo

phase3Production.content: The spy relied on trickery and subterfuge to obtain the secret documents.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to escape from tight corners help form him?

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Trốn thoát khỏi 'tight corners' (các góc hẹp -> các tình huống khó khăn, kẹt)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To get out of difficult or dangerous situations
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thoát khỏi những tình huống khó khăn

phase3Production.content: He has a reputation for being able to escape from tight corners using his quick thinking.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: This is the one area where the book doesn't quite hit the mark.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Cuốn sách 'doesn't quite' (không hoàn toàn) 'hit the mark' (trúng đích, đạt yêu cầu)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Fails to be completely successful, accurate, or effective
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Không hoàn toàn đạt/trúng đích

phase3Production.content: His presentation was good, but his answer to the final question didn't quite hit the mark.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...his depiction...as an ineffective, pleasure-loving monarch...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'monarch' (vị vua) 'pleasure-loving' (ham vui) và 'ineffective' (không hiệu quả, bất tài)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A king or queen who is not good at their job (ineffectual) and is more focused on enjoyment and leisure
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Một vị vua bất tài, ham vui

phase3Production.content: History remembers him as an ineffective, pleasure-loving monarch who ignored the needs of his people.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...doesn't do justice to the man (neither is it accurate)...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Doesn't do justice to' (không công bằng với, không phản ánh đúng) con người ông ta

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To fail to represent someone or something in a way that is fair, accurate, or shows their true qualities
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Không phản ánh đúng/không công bằng với

phase3Production.content: It means the description is unfair. The real man was more complex or better than the book shows. A simple photo doesn't do justice to the beauty of the Grand Canyon.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: But this one niggle aside, To Catch a King is an excellent read...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Bỏ 'aside' (sang một bên) 'this one niggle' (một 'niggle' - sự phàn nàn nhỏ, chi tiết vụn vặt)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Apart from this one small, minor complaint or criticism
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bỏ qua một phàn nàn/lấn cấn nhỏ này

phase3Production.content: The service was a bit slow, but that one niggle aside, the restaurant was fantastic.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...and those who come to it... will find they have a treat in store.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sẽ thấy họ có một 'treat' (điều thú vị, món quà) 'in store' (đang chờ, dự trữ sẵn)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To have something special, exciting, or very pleasant planned or waiting for someone
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Có một điều thú vị/bất ngờ đang chờ

phase3Production.content: If you enjoyed his first book, you have a treat in store with his new sequel.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Complete the summary... A: military innovation

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự 'innovation' (đổi mới, cải tiến) 'military' (thuộc về quân sự)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A new idea, method, or technology related to a country's armed forces
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự đổi mới/cải tiến quân sự

phase3Production.content: The development of the tank was a major military innovation in World War I.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Complete the summary... B: large reward

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'reward' (phần thưởng) 'large' (lớn). (Paraphrase cho 'huge sum offered')

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A significant amount of money or other prize offered for finding someone or something
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Phần thưởng lớn

phase3Production.content: The police offered a large reward for any information about the missing child.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Complete the summary... C: widespread conspiracy

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'conspiracy' (âm mưu) 'widespread' (lan rộng)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A secret plan by a large group of people (spread across many places) to do something harmful or illegal
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Âm mưu lan rộng

phase3Production.content: The media uncovered a widespread conspiracy to fix the election results.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Complete the summary... F: decisive victory

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'victory' (chiến thắng) 'decisive' (mang tính quyết định). (Ngược nghĩa với 'resounding defeat')

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A victory that is clear, final, and settles the issue without doubt
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Chiến thắng mang tính quyết định

phase3Production.content: The battle resulted in a decisive victory for the allied forces.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Complete the summary... G: political debate

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Cuộc 'debate' (tranh luận) 'political' (chính trị)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A formal discussion on a matter of public policy or government
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Cuộc tranh luận chính trị

phase3Production.content: The election season is always filled with intense political debate.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Complete the summary... H: strategic alliance

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'alliance' (liên minh) 'strategic' (mang tính chiến lược). (Paraphrase cho 'did a deal with the Scots')

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A formal agreement or partnership between two groups or countries, made to achieve a specific long-term goal
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Liên minh chiến lược

phase3Production.content: The two companies formed a strategic alliance to enter the new market.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Complete the summary... I: popular solution

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'solution' (giải pháp) 'popular' (phổ biến, được lòng dân)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A way of solving a problem that is liked or supported by many people
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Giải pháp phổ biến/được ưa chuộng

phase3Production.content: Tax cuts are almost always a popular solution, even if they are not sustainable.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Complete the summary... J: religious conviction

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Sự 'conviction' (tin tưởng mạnh mẽ) 'religious' (thuộc về tôn giáo). (Paraphrase cho 'principles his father died for')

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A very strong belief or opinion related to faith or a particular religion
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Tín ngưỡng tôn giáo (mãnh liệt)

phase3Production.content: He refused to fight on the grounds of his strong religious convictions.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Questions 32-35... Charles chose Pepys for the task because he considered him to be trustworthy.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Considered' (coi) ai đó 'to be' (là) 'trustworthy' (đáng tin cậy)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To believe or have the opinion that someone is reliable, honest, and can be trusted
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Coi (ai đó) là đáng tin cậy

phase3Production.content: She is widely considered to be a trustworthy and dependable employee.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Questions 32-35... Charles's personal recollection of the escape lacked sufficient detail.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Hồi ức 'lacked' (thiếu) 'sufficient' (đủ) 'detail' (chi tiết). (Ngược nghĩa với 'related in great detail')

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Did not have enough information or specific points
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thiếu chi tiết đầy đủ

phase3Production.content: The police report was criticized because it lacked sufficient detail about the incident.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: Questions 36-40... What is the reviewer's main purpose in the first paragraph?

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Main purpose' (mục đích chính) 'of' (của) 'reviewer' (người đánh giá)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The primary reason or intention of the person writing the book review
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Mục đích chính của người đánh giá

phase3Production.content: The reviewer's main purpose seems to be to criticize the book's weak plot.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to give an account of the circumstances leading to Charles II's escape.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Cung cấp một 'account' (bản tường thuật, lời kể) 'of' (về) các 'circumstances' (tình huống)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To provide a description or report of events or a situation
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Kể lại/tường thuật về

phase3Production.content: The witness was asked to give an account of what she saw on the night of the crime.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...to provide details of the Parliamentarians' political views.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Views' (quan điểm) 'political' (chính trị)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A person's opinions or beliefs about politics and government
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Quan điểm chính trị

phase3Production.content: It's generally best to avoid discussing political views at family dinners.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...examples of the fugitives' behaviour in the third paragraph?

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Behaviour' (hành vi) 'of' (của) 'fugitives' (những người chạy trốn)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: The way that the people who were running away or hiding acted or conducted themselves
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Hành vi của những người chạy trốn

phase3Production.content: The fugitives' behaviour became more desperate as the search intensified.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...that Charles's supporters were badly prepared.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Được 'prepared' (chuẩn bị) 'badly' (tồi, tệ)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: Not ready or equipped for something; having made poor preparations
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Chuẩn bị tồi/không kỹ

phase3Production.content: The team lost the match because they were badly prepared for the opponent's strategy.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: He misunderstood the motives of his opponents.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Misunderstood' (hiểu sai) 'the motives' (động cơ) của đối thủ

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To fail to correctly understand the reasons behind someone's actions
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Hiểu sai động cơ

phase3Production.content: The manager completely misunderstood the motives of his employees.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: He aimed to restore people's faith in the monarchy.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Restore' (khôi phục) 'faith' (niềm tin) 'of' (của) 'people' (người dân) 'in' (vào) 'monarchy' (chế độ quân chủ)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To bring back a feeling of trust and confidence in an institution, person, or idea
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Khôi phục niềm tin của người dân vào

phase3Production.content: The new government's main task is to restore people's faith in the economy.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: He was driven by a desire to be popular.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Bị 'driven' (thúc đẩy) 'by' (bởi) 'a desire' (một mong muốn)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To be strongly motivated or compelled to act because of a strong wish
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bị thúc đẩy bởi một mong muốn

phase3Production.content: She was driven by a desire to make a difference in the world.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: He takes an unbiased approach to the subject matter.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'approach' (cách tiếp cận) 'unbiased' (không thiên vị). (Paraphrase cho 'even-handed sympathy')

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A way of dealing with something that is fair, impartial, and not influenced by personal opinions
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Cách tiếp cận không thiên vị

phase3Production.content: A good journalist must take an unbiased approach to reporting the news.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...language that is suitable for a twenty-first-century audience.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Language' (ngôn ngữ) 'suitable for' (phù hợp với) 'audience' (khán giả) thế kỷ 21

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: A style of writing or speaking that is appropriate for a particular group of people
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Ngôn ngữ phù hợp với

phase3Production.content: The presenter used language suitable for an audience with no technical knowledge.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: it overlooks the impact of events on ordinary people.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Overlooks' (bỏ qua, phớt lờ) 'the impact' (sự ảnh hưởng)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To fail to notice or consider the effect or influence that events have
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bỏ qua/phớt lờ sự ảnh hưởng

phase3Production.content: The report is flawed because it overlooks the long-term impact on the environment.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: it lacks an analysis of prevalent views on monarchy.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Lacks' (thiếu) 'an analysis' (một sự phân tích) 'of' (về) 'prevalent views' (các quan điểm thịnh hành)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To not have a detailed examination or study of common or widespread opinions
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Thiếu một sự phân tích về

phase3Production.content: The article is interesting but lacks a serious analysis of the underlying causes.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: it omits any references to the deceit practised by Charles II...

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: 'Omits' (bỏ qua, không nhắc đến) 'any references to' (bất kỳ sự đề cập nào đến) 'deceit' (sự lừa dối)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: To fail to include or mention any information about a particular subject (e.g., the deceit)
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Bỏ qua/không đề cập đến

phase3Production.content: The politician's speech suspiciously omits any references to his failed promises.

lexicalItems.sourceContext: ...Charles II's experiences had a lasting influence on him.

phase1Inference.contextualGuessVI: Một 'influence' (sự ảnh hưởng) 'lasting' (kéo dài) 'on him' (lên ông ta)

phase2Annotation.definitionEN: An effect or impact that continued for a long time on his character or actions
phase2Annotation.translationVI: Sự ảnh hưởng lâu dài lên ông ấy

phase3Production.content: His time spent travelling the world had a lasting influence on his writing.
